name: PoCoTo
body:
### What is PoCoTo?
It is a tool for the postcorrection of OCR'd documents.
It has been developed by the IMPACT working group at the Centrum fÃ¼r Informations- und Sprachverarbeitung, University of Munich.
Additional Information can be found [here](http://ocr.cis.uni-muenchen.de/).

### FAQ
- How is it implemented?

    PoCoTo is written in Java. It is built as a Netbeans Platform Application.

- What do i need to run it?

    All you need is a Java runtime on your machine. (Version > 7)

- What types of ocr'd files can be loaded?
    
    At the moment PoCoTo can deal with Google HOcr files as well as with Abbyy XML Output.

- What types of image files can be used?

    Right now, only support for .tiff files is implemented

- Where can i get the software

    For developing, download the project from this github.
    For the binaries only, you can get it here: [Download](http://www.cis.uni-muenchen.de/~voblt/ocrcorrection.zip)

- Where can i find additional information?

    At the github wiki that belongs to this project. [Link](https://github.com/thorstenv/PoCoTo/wiki)
    Or email @thorstenv or @ciskristof
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
